pages.text: $(li)The Honey Block is a block that has works very well with $(l:patchouli:redstone/vanilla/piston)$(l:patchouli:redstone/vanilla/piston)Piston$(/l)s$(/l).
$(li)When a Honey Block is moved by a piston, it attempts to move all adjacent blocks in the same directions.

$(li)A Honey Block can move any block a $(l:patchouli:redstone/vanilla/sticky_piston)$(l:patchouli:redstone/vanilla/sticky_piston)Sticky $(l:patchouli:redstone/vanilla/piston)Piston$(/l)$(/l)$(/l) can pull, except Glazed Terracota and $(l:patchouli:redstone/vanilla/slime_block)Slime Blocks$(/l).
$(li)The blocks that are move may, in turn, push other blocks, as if they were being pushed by a piston.

$(li)When the adjacent block that is moved is also a Honey Block, that block also attempts to move all its adjacent blocks.$(br)$(li)Honey Blocks are not pulled by a non-sticky piston, nor are they moved if an adjacent (non-honey) block is moved by a piston.$(br)$(li)The maximum of 12 blocks moved by a piston still applies.
$(li)Honey Blocks moved by pistons do not move entities that are touching the side or bottom of the block.
